title: Verify: Selecting the Fox Sports Go app icon successfully opens the Fox Sports Go Amazon FireTV app
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Amazon FireTV (Stick or Console)
AND their AndroidTV device is currently connected to a wired network
AND the "Fox Sports Go" app is present in the device Apps Menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects Fox Sports Go from the device Apps menu
custom_expected: THEN the Fox Sports Go app will open successfully

title: Verify: Fox Sports Go can be accessed while the Amazon FireTV  device is connected wirelessly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Amazon FireTV (Stick or Console)
AND their AndroidTV  device is currently connected to a wireless network
AND the "Fox Sports Go" app is present in the device Apps Menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects Fox Sports Go from the device Apps menu
custom_expected: THEN the Fox Sports Go app will open successfully

title: Unauthenticated account is allowed to browse content items found within the Fox Sports Go App
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND has not authenticated their Cable Provider account details
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates through Content Files 
AND the user navigates through any/all Content items found within the App
custom_expected:
The user will be prompted with Content files that contain "Key" icons on top of their photo tile


Before Failing Issue please see below:

* Users that are not authenticated have access to Free Channels. A Free channel will not display the key

title: Cable Authorization "Activate" initialization when Content item is selected for Playback
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND has not authenticated their Cable Provider account details
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates through Content Files 
AND the user selects Any Content items found within the App
THEN presses select to ENTER and PLAY the media content
custom_expected: User will be prompted with the Cable Authorization "Activate" screen, with full CODE and website details

title: "Activate" Notification for Cable Provider - Web Flow
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND has not authenticated their Cable Provider account details
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates through Content Files 
AND the user selects Any Content items found within the App
THEN presses select to ENTER and PLAY the media content
AND is prompted with the "Activate" Cable Authentication screen
custom_expected: The user must initiate the Web ONLY section of the Cable Provider Authentication process

title: Cable Authentication - Web Flow - Desktop License Plate
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND has not authenticated their Cable Provider account details
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates through Content Files 
THEN presses select to ENTER and PLAY the media content
AND is prompted with the "Activate" Cable Authentication screen
THEN uses a Desktop computer to access the "www.foxsportsgo.com/Activate" site
custom_expected: The user will be prompted with the Desktop License Plate Web Interface

title: Cable Authentication - Web Flow - Enter Device Application Code
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go Web "Activate" code Desktop License 
AND has entered the Authentication Code provided within the Fox Sports Go Device app
custom_steps:
WHEN the user initiates the Web-ONLY section of the Cable Provider Authentication process
AND has entered the Authentication Code provided within the Fox Sports Go Device app 
THEN clicks submit within the Desktop License plate
custom_expected: THE user will be prompted within the Web License Plate to select a Cable Provider

title: Cox
custom_expected: Ensure that the Cable provider COX is present within the Main Authentication Subscription List

title: Verizon
custom_expected: Ensure that the Cable provider Verizon is present within the Main Authentication Subscription List

title: DirecTV
custom_expected: Ensure that the Cable provider DirecTV is present within the Main Authentication Subscription List

title: Optimum.
custom_expected: Ensure that the Cable provider Optimum. is present within the Main Authentication Subscription List

title: Time Warner Cable
custom_expected: Ensure that the Cable provider Time Warner Cable is present within the Main Authentication Subscription List

title: Xfinity
custom_expected:
Ensure that the Cable provider Xfinity is not present within the Main Authentication Subscription List

*This provider will not be listed on Amazon Fire TV
https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/FSGANDSTB-301

title: Charter
custom_expected:
Ensure that the Cable provider ATT U-verse is not present within the Main Authentication Subscription List

*This provider will not be listed on Amazon Fire TV
https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/FSGANDSTB-301

title: Dish
custom_expected: Ensure that the Cable provider Dish is present within the Main Authentication Subscription List

title: "More TV Providers"
custom_expected: Ensure that the "More TV Providers" sub-menu selection button is present within the Main Authentication Subscription List

title: Desktop More TV Providers - Auto-Populate
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND does not have their Cable Provider listed
custom_steps:
WHEN the user is prompted within the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow 
AND selects the More TV Providers button on the Web License Plate
THEN types in any letter in the alphabet into the text Search bar
custom_expected: The user is prompted with an Auto Populated list of additional Cable Providers to complete their Authentication process for the App

title: Desktop Web Flow "More TV Providers" - No Matches Found
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND does not have their Cable Provider listed
custom_steps:
WHEN the user is prompted within the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow 
AND selects the More TV Providers button on the Web License Plate
THEN types in a provider that does not offer Fox Sports Go Cable Subscription Authentication
custom_expected: The user will be prompted with messaging within the Desktop License Plate that states "No Matches Found"

title: Desktop DIRECTV Sign In - Authentication Initialization
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user enters their Device Code found within the Device application "Activate" screen in the Desktop License Plate
custom_steps:
WHEN the user is prompted with the main 9 Cable Provider buttons within the Desktop TV Provider Selection screen
THEN chooses a specific Cable Provider for authentication within the Cable Provider listings on the Web (for this instance DirecTV was used)
AND is prompted with the Cable Authentication sub-menu screen (see DirecTV screencap attachment)
custom_expected: The user will begin to enter valid Cable authentication details within the sub-menu screen

title: Desktop DIRECTV Sign In - Authentication - Bad Credentials
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user enters their Device Code found within the Device application "Activate" screen in the Desktop License Plate
custom_steps:
WHEN the user is prompted with the main 9 Cable Provider buttons within the Desktop TV Provider Selection screen
THEN chooses a specific Cable Provider for authentication within the Cable Provider listings on the Web (for this instance DirecTV was used)
AND is prompted with the Cable Authentication sub-menu screen (see DirecTV screencap attachment)
THEN the user will enters invalid Cable authentication details within the sub-menu screen
custom_expected: The user will be prompted with error messaging and will have to re-enter valid authentication credentials

title: Desktop Activation Complete – Sign In/Sign Up to FS Account - Confirmation
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user enters their Device Code found within the Device application "Activate" screen in the Desktop License Plate
custom_steps:
WHEN the user is prompted with the main 9 Cable Provider buttons within the Desktop TV Provider Selection screen
THEN chooses a specific Cable Provider for authentication within the Cable Provider listings on the Web (for this instance DirecTV was used)
AND is prompted with the Cable Authentication sub-menu screen 
THEN enters valid Cable Provider authentication email and password for the selected provider
custom_expected: The user will be prompted with the activation "Success" screen on the Web

title: ***FUTURE USE***FOX Sports Account Sign Up Pop-up
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user has completed the full Device App code/Cable Authentication flow via Device and Desktop Web
custom_steps:
WHEN the user enters a valid Cable Provider authentication email and password for the selected provider within the final Web flow sequence
THEN is prompted with and selects the FOX Sports Account Sign Up Popup
custom_expected: The user will be asked to begin Fox Sports account Sign-up via Web

title: ***FUTURE USE***Facebook/Twitter - FS Sign Up Pop-up - Web
custom_preconds:
***NOTE: This functionality doesn't currently exist in the product (as of build 3.1.2.146 - 10/25/2016). Mark this test case as BLOCKED until the functionality is added, then edit this case and remove this disclaimer sentence and test as normal.

GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user has completed the full Device App code/Cable Authentication flow via Device and Desktop Web
custom_steps:
WHEN the user enters a valid Cable Provider authentication email and password for the selected provider within the final Web flow sequence
THEN is prompted with and selects the FOX Sports Account Sign Up Popup - via FaceBook or Twitter
custom_expected: The user will be asked to begin Fox Sports account Sign-up via Facebook or Twitter authentication flows

title: Tile "Key" icon removal from all Content items
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user has completed the full Device App code/Cable Authentication flow via Device and Desktop Web
custom_steps:
WHEN the user prompted with the activation "Success" screen on the Web
THEN returns back to the Fox Sports Go application on the Amazon FireTV (Stick or Console) device 
AND begins cycling through all Content menu items
custom_expected: The user will notice that all previous Content items no longer contain the "Key" icon found previously within the menu tiles

title: Access to all previously gated areas of application (LiveTV / VOD)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user has completed the full Device App code/Cable Authentication flow via Device and Desktop Web
custom_steps:
WHEN the user prompted with the activation "Success" screen on the Web
THEN returns back to the Fox Sports Go application on the Amazon FireTV (Stick or Console) device 
AND begins cycling through all Content menu items
custom_expected: The user will notice that all previous Menu items will now be accessible

title: Menu Shift Verification - UI
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the "Fox Sports Go" application
AND the USER browsing Content items found within the application
custom_steps: WHEN the user starts scrolling the chips to the right.
custom_expected: Menu is minimized and slides in to left. When user scrolls back to left, the menu slides out to the right along with the first chips. (Menu selection items - LIVE TV / SEARCH)

title: Verify Menu Content items are appearing properly within the application
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the "Fox Sports Go" application
AND the USER browsing Content items found within the application
custom_steps: WHEN the user starts scrolling through the Menu items
custom_expected:
THEN Main Menu selection items - LIVE TV / SEARCH / Settings (Hour Glass Button) will be visible and accessible 

***Above are the current Phase v.1 items, with more Phases additional Menu items are set to be introduced***

title: User lands on "Search" Page after activating the Search Button from "Main Menu"
custom_steps:
WHEN user presses left on remote to open Main Menu
AND navigates to and activates "Search" button
custom_expected: THEN User will land on "Search" page

title: Verify Recent Search / Channel listing appears
custom_steps: WHEN the user initializes Search Functionality
custom_expected:
THEN by default, Recent Searches and Channels will appear in list below Search Box

**edit:** Amazon Fire TV devices use a different on screen keyboard than Google Android TV devices. The onscreen keyboard overlays the rest of the screen and does not offer auto complete. So this **recent search is not going to work on AFTV** - https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/FSGANDSTB-12

title: Verify and Confirm Channel listing order
custom_preconds:
View "Live" EPG 
AND Annotate what is avail for user to view
custom_steps:
WHEN The user initializes Search Functionality
AND Enters a Key Word using the "Live" EPG list (Precondition step)
custom_expected:
THEN  Under the search bar, "Live Now" carousel results will display first (If search returns live results)
AND  "Upcoming" carousel results follows below

title: Verify Auto-Population for Text search functionality
custom_preconds:
WHEN User is on the "Search" page 
And Has navigate to "Search" text box
custom_steps:
WHEN User types in a key word (examples: baseball, UFC and  Football)
And Presses enter on remote
custom_expected:
THEN Suggested list appears below.

**edit:** Amazon Fire TV devices use a different on screen keyboard than Google Android TV devices. The onscreen keyboard overlays the rest of the screen and **does not offer auto complete**. So this feature is not going to work on AFTV - https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/FSGANDSTB-12

title: Verify Search results with Live content
custom_preconds: LIVE content is present at the time of verification
custom_steps: WHEN the user initializes Search Functionality
custom_expected:
Live content in Search results - Whenever there is Live content for searched results, the Live content appears at the very top displayed as a larger chip.

If there are more than 1 live chip, display next ones to the right of the 1st live chip.

For Upcoming - Show only upcoming events.

title: Verify Search results with no LIVE content
custom_preconds: LIVE content is NOT present at the time of verification
custom_steps: WHEN the user initializes Search Functionality
custom_expected:
THEN "Live" carousel will not display
AND "Upcoming" carousel will display below the search text field

title: Full Live Linear Schedule - "ON NOW" Video content Playback Start to Exit
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the "Fox Sports Go" application
AND the USER is signed in with a valid Cable Authentication account
custom_steps:
WHEN we launch ANY LIVE TV video feed with a TRT > 2mins
AND watch to completion
custom_expected:
THEN playback will commence and continue without stalls or skips
AND the user will not be kicked out of the stream unexpectedly
AND upon completion the app will return to Schedule (asset) page

title: Full Featured item Playback to Exit
custom_preconds: GIVEN we have accessed the "Fox Sports Go" application
custom_steps:
WHEN we launch ANY "Featured" video content item
AND watch to completion
custom_expected:
THEN playback will commence and continue without stalls or skips
AND the user will not be kicked out of the stream unexpectedly
AND upon completion the app will return to Featured asset page

title: Verify All Upcoming Content items - populate on Today Page sub-menu display
custom_preconds: GIVEN User is on 'Home" page
custom_steps: When User traverses down the sections
custom_expected:
THEN Home page sections will be:

Live Now Carousel
Featured
Upcoming 
Tomorrow
Day of week (Tomorrow + 1) *Example: Monday*
Day of week (Tomorrow + 2)
Day of week (Tomorrow + 3)
Day of week (Tomorrow + 4)

title: Verify video/audio pauses when search is activated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have the Fox Sports Go their Amazon FireTV (CONSOLE ONLY) device connected to a wired network connection
AND the user has accessed the "Fox Sports Go" Application
custom_steps:
WHEN the USER locates any media content file
AND the USER plays ANY media content file
AND while media is playing, user activates Voice search/Alexa (press the microphone button on the controller)
custom_expected: The video/audio pauses when voice search/Alexa is invoked.

title: Verify video/audio resumes when search is cancelled
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have the Fox Sports Go their Amazon FireTV (CONSOLE ONLY) device connected to a wired network connection
AND the user has accessed the "Fox Sports Go" Application
custom_steps:
WHEN the USER locates any media content file
AND the USER plays ANY media content file
AND while media is playing, user activates Voice search/Alexa (press the microphone button on the controller)
 - Video and Audio should pause while voice search/Alexa is invoked
AND user then cancels voice search/Alexa
custom_expected: The video/audio resumes when voice search/Alexa is cancelled.

title: Verify Featured Chip items (Featured Content Show Tiles) appear and are accessible
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the "Fox Sports Go" application
AND the USER browsing Content items found within the application

***If no programs are above the "minimum threshold promotional value" then the Featured section should be removed.***
custom_steps: WHEN the user starts scrolling through the Featured sub-section items
custom_expected: There will be a limit of six programs/chips found within the Featured sub-section.

title: Verify that Feature Content Show Tiles (chips) are correct size
custom_expected: There should not be a double wide chip in the Featured section and the chips will be ordered in chronology.

title: Wired Connection: Launch and playback - CONSOLE ONLY
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have the Fox Sports Go their Amazon FireTV (CONSOLE ONLY) device connected to a wired network connection
AND the user has accessed the "Fox Sports Go" Application
custom_steps:
WHEN the USER locates any media content file
AND the USER attempts to play ANY media content file
custom_expected:
THEN the media video stream will launch successfully
AND the media content file will play without issue

title: Wireless Connection: Launch and playback
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have the Fox Sports Go Amazon FireTV (Stick or Console) device connected to a wireless network connection
AND the user has accessed the "Fox Sports Go" Application
custom_steps:
WHEN the USER locates any media content file
AND the USER attempts to play ANY media content file
custom_expected:
THEN the media video stream will launch successfully
AND the media content file will play without issue

title: Network: Verify bandwidth/stream quality adapts with network fluctuations
Network: Verify video quality improves with connectivity improvement
Network: Verify when throttling connection strength that bitrate playback adjusts without issue in both directions
LIVE Video Playback: Wired Connection Lost *** (CONSOLE ONLY)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Video Stream is successfully playing full screen
AND the their Amazon FireTV (CONSOLE ONLY) device is connected to a wired network connection
custom_steps: WHEN we disconnect the LAN from the wall
custom_expected: THEN an expected network failure message appears for the application

title: LIVE Video Playback: Wireless Connection Lost ***
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Video Stream is successfully playing full screen
AND the Amazon FireTV (Stick or Console) is connected to an Ad Hoc wifi network
custom_steps: WHEN we turn off the Ad Hoc wifi network
custom_expected: THEN an expected network failure message appears for the application

title: Ensure MultiView icon appears
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. Begin playing any Feed.
2. Access Video Player UI
custom_expected:
Ensure MultiView icon appears on the Video Player UI

![](index.php?/attachments/get/3632)

title: Ensure MultiView icon on the Video Player UI can be selected
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. Begin playing any Feed.

2. Access Video Player UI

3. Select Multi-View icon
custom_expected:
Ensure Multi-View icon on the Video Player UI can be selected, and once selected the icon turns orange

![](index.php?/attachments/get/3633)

title: Ensure the MultiView picker icons appear below the video player UI
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. Begin playing any Feed.

2. Access Video Player UI

3. Select Multi-View icon
custom_expected: The MultiView picker icons should appear below the video player UI and the ‘Full’ View icon is currently the default selection, as indicated by its orange color

title: Ensure all of the MultiView picker icons can be navigated to and selected
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. Begin playing any Feed.
2. Access Video Player UI
3. Select Multi-View icon
4. Press down to access the Mutli-View Screen Layout icons
custom_expected:
All of the MultiView picker icons can be navigated to and selected, including Full, and the icons will turn orange to indicate they’ve been selected

AND

Ensure all text is clear, readable, and free from errors

title: Ensure that Full can be selected
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. Begin playing any Feed.
2. Access Video Player UI
3. Select Multi-View icon
4. Press down to access the Mutli-View Screen Layout icons
5. Select a view other than Full
6. Navigate back to Full and select it
custom_expected: Full Screen can be selected and the UI below will change from having Screen/Audio Selector directly under the View icons to having Live TV (Since Full Screen view is one screen it doesn't need the Screen/Audio Selector section)

title: Ensure that with Full selected, the video player UI still functions as expected
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. Play any Feed in Full Screen view.
2. Access Video Player UI
3. Navigate to and select different elements of the video player UI
custom_expected: With Full selected, the video player UI still functions as expected (Pause, Play, FFWD, RWD and CC enable/disable)

title: Ensure that while the video UI is onscreen that the MVPD logo will be present
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. Play any Feed in Full Screen view.
2. Access Video Player UI
custom_expected: While the video UI is onscreen that the MVPD logo will be present in the upper right hand corner if the user scrolls to the top.

title: Ensure that the Video Player UI, after being enabled, disappears after ~5 seconds
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. Play any Feed in Full Screen view.
2. Access Video Player UI
3. Cease pressing buttons on the remote/controller
custom_expected: The Video Player UI, after being enabled, disappears after around 5 seconds of no input from the remote/controller.

title: Ensure that with Full selected, all current Live feeds will display below
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. Play any Feed in Full Screen view.
2. Access Feed picker
custom_expected:
All current Live feeds will display below the View Screen picker icons (Full, PIP, etc.) and that the feeds can be scrolled through from left to right and back again with no issues

AND

Ensure that the displayed currently Live feeds are indeed the correct ones

title: Ensure that the currently selected feed will be indicated
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. With any Feed playing in Full Screen view.
2. Access Feed picker
custom_expected: The currently selected feed will be indicated with the Full Screen icon turning orange.

title: Ensure that another feed can be selected and will begin playing
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. With any Feed playing in Full Screen view.
2. Access Feed picker
3. Switch to a new Feed
custom_expected: Another feed can be selected and will begin playing without issue, and that once selected the Full Screen icon will turn orange.

title: Ensure that any Live feed with a start time >2 hours ago can be selected
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. With any Feed playing in Full Screen view.
2. Access Feed picker
3. Switch to a new Feed with a start time >2 hours ago
custom_expected: Ensure that if any Live feed is displayed with a start time greater than 2 hours ago, that it can be selected and played without issue

title: Ensure that audio for the feed plays without issue and syncs acceptably
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. With any Feed playing in Full Screen view.
2. Listen to the audio and observe the video for the selected feed.
custom_expected: Ensure that audio for the currently selected feed plays without issue and syncs acceptably with the displayed video

title: Ensure when feeds switch that audio plays without issue and sync acceptably
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. With any Feed playing in Full Screen view.
2. Listen to the audio and observe the video for the selected feed.
3. In the LIVE TV Feed picker switch to a new feed.
custom_expected: When switching feeds the audio will switch accordingly and play without issue and sync acceptably with the displayed video

title: Select PiP and ensure UI updates accordingly
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. Begin playing any Feed.
2. Access Video Player UI
3. Select Multi-View icon
4. Press down to access the Mutli-View Screen Layout icons
5. Select PIP
custom_expected: Once PIP is selected, the Screen/Audio Selector will have Primary and PiP screen available as options below the Multiview picker icons

title: Ensure that video player UI’s functions are greyed out
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. With PIP playing any Feed.
2. Access Video Player UI
3. Navigate to and select different elements of the video player UI
custom_expected: With PiP selected, the video player UI’s functions are greyed out and cannot be activated (Pause, Play, FFWD, RWD and CC enable/disable)---the only icons able to be activated once Multi-View is chosen will be the view selector below the Video UI bar

title: Ensure that the Video Player UI disappears after ~5 seconds
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. Play any Feed in PIP Screen view.
2. Access Video Player UI
3. Cease pressing buttons on the remote/controller
custom_expected: The Video Player UI, after being enabled, disappears after around 5 seconds of no input from the remote/controller

title: Ensure that Primary and PiP screen can be switched between freely

custom_steps:
1. Play any Feed in PIP Screen view.
2. Access the Screen/Audio Selector section
3. Choose a different screen option and observe app behavior
4. Switch back to the initial screen option and observe app behavior
custom_expected: The Primary and PiP screen can be switched between freely

title: Ensure that either selection, Primary or PiP screen will turn orange
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. Play any Feed in PIP Screen view.
2. Access the Screen/Audio Selector section
3. Choose a different screen option and observe app behavior
4. Switch back to the initial screen option and observe app behavior
custom_expected: Either selection, Primary or PiP screen, will have its icon turn orange when it is the currently selected option.

title: Ensure all text for the Screen/Audio Selector area is free from errors
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. Access the Screen/Audio Selector section
2. Observe text of all options
custom_expected: Ensure all text for the Screen/Audio Selector area is clear, readable, and free from errors

title: Ensure that all current Live feeds will display below with no issues
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. Play any Feed in PIP Screen view.
2. Access the LIVE TV Feed Selector section
3. Scroll through the feeds from left to right and back again
custom_expected:
All current Live feeds will display below the Screen/Audio Selector and that the feeds can be scrolled through from left to right and back again with no issues

AND

That the displayed currently Live feeds are indeed the correct ones

title: Ensure that the current Live feed defaulted to ‘Primary’ Screen
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. Choose PIP Screen view.
2. Observe the LIVE TV Feed Selector section
custom_expected:
The current Live feed below the Screen/Audio Selector for ‘Primary’ is the feed that was playing when Multi-View was first selected

AND

The currently selected feed will be indicated with its icon turning orange.

title: Ensure that while no PiP Screen feed selected, that Live feeds have no issues
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. Choose PIP Screen view.
2. In Screen/Audio Selector section, select PiP screen (such that the grey rectangle appears in the upper right of the screen)
3. Access the LIVE TV feed selector section
4. Scroll to the right and back left again
custom_expected: While PiP Screen is selected (with no PiP screen *feed* selected), that the Live feeds can be scrolled through from left to right and back again with no issues.

title: Ensure that a different feed can be selected as the Primary feed
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. With any Feed playing in PIP Screen's Primary screen.
2. Access Feed picker
3. Switch to a new Feed

**edit:** To switch to a new feed, user must first unselect the current feed - https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/FSGANDSTB-333
custom_expected: Ensure that a different feed can be selected and will begin playing as the Primary feed, and that once selected the icon will turn orange on the newly selected feed.

title: Ensure that any Live feed with a start time >2 hours ago can be selected
custom_preconds: Be logged into the app with an MVPD account.
custom_steps:
1. With any Feed playing in PIP Screen's Primary screen.
2. Access Feed picker
3. Switch to a new Feed with a start time >2 hours ago
custom_expected: Ensure that if any Live feed is displayed with a start time greater than 2 hours ago, that it can be selected and played without issue as the Primary screen feed

title: Ensure when PiP Screen is selected (with no feed selected) UI updates
custom_preconds: Be logged in with an MPVD account, have MultiView enabled
custom_steps:
1. Select PIP MultiView icon
2. In Screen/Audio Selector move selection from Primary to PiP Screen.
3. Choose PiP Screen.
custom_expected:
A grey rectangle (the feed player) appears in the upper right corner of the screen overlaying the Primary screen’s feed and while the video UI is onscreen that the MVPD logo will be present in the upper right hand corner

AND

Live feeds can be scrolled through from left to right and back again with no issues 

AND

No title is displayed on the video player UI until a feed has been chosen (will choose one in the next case)

![](index.php?/attachments/get/3634)

title: Ensure that with PiP Screen selected that a LIVE TV feed can be selected and UI updates
custom_preconds: Be logged in with an MPVD account, have MultiView enabled
custom_steps:
1. Select PIP MultiView icon
2. In Screen/Audio Selector move selection from Primary to PiP Screen.
3. Choose PiP Screen
4. Move down to Feeds and choose any available Feed.
custom_expected:
While PiP Screen is selected a feed can be selected and will begin playing as the PiP Screen feed (replacing the grey rectangle) in the upper right corner of the screen

AND

Once selected the icon will turn orange on the newly selected feed.

title: Ensure that any Live feed with a start time >2 hours ago can be selected
custom_preconds:
Be logged in with an MPVD account, have MultiView enabled

AND

Have feeds listed in the Feeds section that started >2 hours ago
custom_steps:
1. Select PIP MultiView icon
2. In Screen/Audio Selector move selection from Primary to PiP Screen.
3. Choose PiP Screen
4. Move down to Feeds and choose any Feed that started >2 hours ago.
custom_expected: Ensure that if any Live feed is displayed with a start time greater than 2 hours ago, that it can be selected and played without issue as the PiP Screen feed

title: Ensure that switching between Primary and PiP Screen works as expected
custom_preconds: Be logged in with an MPVD account, have MultiView enabled
custom_steps:
1. Select PIP MultiView icon
2. In Screen/Audio Selector move selection from Primary to PiP Screen.
3. Choose PiP Screen
4. Move down to Feeds and choose any Feed.
5. Once feeds are going for both Primary and PIP, switch between them a few times in the Screen/Audio Selector
custom_expected:
Switching between Primary and PiP Screen in the Screen/Audio Selector will switch the Feed’s title (on the video player UI) to that of the currently chosen view’s feed (i.e. Primary view is playing ‘UFC Reloaded - UFC 185: Pettis vs. Dos Ajos’ and PiP Screen is playing ‘Red Bull X Fighters - Madrid’, whichever view is the currently chosen one in the Screen/Audio Selector will have the title displayed above the video player UI when it is present on-screen)

AND

While the video player UI is onscreen that the MVPD logo will be correct and present in the upper right hand corner (check both views/feeds)

![](index.php?/attachments/get/3688)

Be logged in with an MPVD account, have Multi-View enabled

AND

Have several feeds available from one channel (a channel such as FS1, FS2, CFS, etc.)
custom_steps:
1. Select Mosaic Screen Multi-View icon
2. In Screen/Audio Selector move selection from Top-Left to Top-Right Screen.
3. Choose Top-Right Screen
4. Move down to Feeds and choose any Feed from the same channel as the one playing in the Top-Left.
5. Once feeds are going for both Top-Left and Top-Right, switch between them a few times in the Screen/Audio Selector
6. In Screen/Audio Selector move selection from Top-Right to Bottom-Right Screen
7. Choose Bottom-Right Screen
8. Move down to Feeds and choose any Feed from the same channel as the one playing in the Top-Left (if available, if not pick another "multiple-feed, same-channel" feed).
9. In Screen/Audio Selector move selection from Bottom-Right to Bottom-Left Screen
10. Choose Bottom-Left Screen
11. Move down to Feeds and choose any Feed from the same channel as the one playing in the Top-Left (if available, if not pick another "multiple-feed, same-channel" feed).
12. Once feeds are going for all screens, observe the audio and video and switch between them occasionally.
custom_expected: Ensure that a channel (such as FS1, FS2, CFS, etc.) that has multiple feeds currently available can have all available feeds enabled in each view (so one FS1 feed in Top-Left Screen, and another different FS1 feed in Top-Right Screen, a third different FS1 feed (if available) can be in the Bottom-Left screen and a fourth different FS1 feed (if available) can be in the Bottom-Right screen) and that the feeds play correctly with no issue

title: Ensure switching betw. any screen will switch the Audio
custom_preconds:
Be logged in with an MPVD account, have Multi-View enabled

AND

Have each screen in Mosaic playing a different feed

AND

Have audio turned up to an audible level
custom_steps:
1. Select Mosaic Screen Multi-View icon
2. On Top-Left Screen, listen to audio
3. In Screen/Audio Selector move selection from Top-Left to Top-Right Screen.
4. Choose Top-Right Screen
5. Listen to audio
6. In Screen/Audio Selector move selection from Top-Right Screen to Bottom-Left.
7. Listen to audio
8. Choose Bottom-Left Screen
9. Listen to audio
10. In Screen/Audio Selector move selection from Bottom-Left Screen to Bottom-Right.
11. Listen to audio
custom_expected: Ensure that switching between any of the screens in the Screen/Audio Selector will switch the currently playing Audio to that of the currently chosen view

title: Ensure that audio for Top-Left Screen feed plays w/o issue
custom_preconds:
Be logged in with an MPVD account, have Multi-View enabled

AND

Have audio turned up to an audible level
custom_steps:
1. Select Mosaic Screen Multi-View icon
2. On Top-Left Screen, listen to audio
custom_expected: Ensure that audio for the currently selected feed for Top-Left Screen plays without issue and syncs acceptably with the displayed video

title: Verify Titles Configurations
custom_expected:
Titles
 
a) For professional and college team events, display team matchup only
    - International Soccer: Manchester City vs. Chelsea
    - All other Team Sports: Jets at Patriots
 
b) For other programs, display program title concatenated with "episode" information as provided by TMS (as is done currently for all programs in FOX Sports GO)
 
d) For non-linear programs, the title that is manually entered when the program is scheduled will be displayed, unless such program falls under the description of (a), in which case, the rules in (a) apply.
 
The ability to manually override (b) with a custom title should be provided
 
More specifically, for team events, we need specific values for the team events to display. The following STATS LLC Fields are to be used:
    - For NFL, MLB, NHL, WNBA, and NBA teams, use STATS LLC          "name"
    - For International Soccer, use STATS LLC "location"
    - For MLS, use STATS LLC "location" concatenated with "name" (separated by a space)
    - For CFB and CBK, use STATS LLC "name"
 
Titles for large chips have a maximum length of 2 lines. If the title extends beyond 2 lines, an ellipsis will appear at the end of the second line (dividing the last word.)
 
Titles for small chips have a maximum of 3 lines.  If the title extends beyond 3 lines, an ellipsis will appear at the end of the third line (dividing the last word.)

title: Verify Sport Tags for EVENTS ONLY

-MLB

-NHRA

title: Verify All available Settings options are visible and accessible in the sub-menu display
Verify TV Provider Sign In/Out Button is visible and accessible in the sub-menu display
Verify Closed Captions Button is visible and accessible in the sub-menu display
custom_expected: **edit:** A captions option cannot be added to settings. Cannot deep link to the system's Closed Caption settings as they vary device-to-device. https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/FSGANDSTB-166

title: Sign-In - App Settings Menu flow
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND has not authenticated their Cable Provider account details
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates through the FOX Sports Go app on the device
THEN enters the Settings menu
AND initiates the MVPD Sign In buttong to bring up Sign In options
custom_expected: The user will initialize the Full Cable Provider Verification - Web Flow and be required to enter valid MVPD Subscription credentials

title: Sign-Out - App Settings Menu flow
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND the user has authenticated their Cable Provider account details via Gated content entitlement check or App Settings Menu flow
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates through the Signed-In FOX Sports Go app on the device

THEN enters the Settings menu

AND initiates the MVPD Sign Out button to bring up Sign-Out confirmation options
custom_expected: THEN the user will initialize the Device applications Sign-Out confirmation screen

title: Sign-Out Confirmation - "Log Out of Fox Sports Go"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND the user has authenticated their Cable Provider account details via Gated content entitlement check or App Settings Menu flow
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates through the Signed-In FOX Sports Go app on the device

THEN enters the Settings menu

AND initiates the MVPD Sign Out button to bring up Sign-Out confirmation options

THEN enters the Sign-Out confirmation screen and chooses the option to "Log Out of Fox Sports Go"
custom_expected: The user will return the Fox Sports Go application to its previous UnAuthenticated state and no Content tiles will be available for playback, and all items will contain the "Key" icon within their tile graphic

title: Sign-Out Confirmation - "Cancel"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND the user has authenticated their Cable Provider account details via Gated content entitlement check or App Settings Menu flow
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates through the Signed-In FOX Sports Go app on the device

THEN enters the Settings menu

AND initiates the MVPD Sign Out button to bring up Sign-Out confirmation options

THEN enters the Sign-Out confirmation screen and chooses the option to "Cancel"
custom_expected: The user will remain within the Fox Sports Go application in it's Authenticated state, all Content items will be available and the locked "Key" icon will NOT appear within their tile graphic

custom_expected: **edit:** FAQ has no answers to questions yet - https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/FSGANDSTB-179

title: Verify Closed Caption Button is present and accessible within Video Player UI
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user has completed the full Device App code/Cable Authentication flow via Device and Desktop Web
custom_steps:
WHEN the user initializes playback for any Content items (LIVE/FEATURED)
THEN toggles the Video Player UI
custom_expected: THEN User can toggle on/off the CC in the video player. Default or user set settings in CC Controls will be applied.

title: Verify Closed Captions are appearing when User has Toggled setting to "ON"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user has completed the full Device App code/Cable Authentication flow via Device and Desktop Web
custom_steps:
WHEN the user initializes playback for any Content items (LIVE/FEATURED)
THEN toggles the Video Player UI to "ON"
custom_expected: THEN the user will view Closed Captions during the the duration of the video's playback

title: Verify Closed Captions do not appear when User has Toggled setting to "OFF"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user has completed the full Device App code/Cable Authentication flow via Device and Desktop Web
custom_steps:
WHEN the user initializes playback for any Content items (LIVE/FEATURED)
THEN toggles the Video Player UI from "ON" (when applicable) to "OFF"
custom_expected: THEN the user will no longer have Closed Captions text appearing on-screen during the the duration of the video's playback
